Qualifiers.applicability: Applies when a guard rail is required in the context of excavation.

Variables.name: guard_rail_design
Variables.description: The aesthetic and structural design of the required guard rail.

Constants.name: design_standard
Constants.ambiguous_language: The term 'architecturally compatible' is subjective and not quantitatively defined, requiring interpretation.

Conditions.logic: IF a guard rail is required THEN this rule applies.
Conditions.dependency: The requirement for a guard rail is established by other, unstated regulations.

Exceptions.description: No exceptions or alternatives are mentioned in the text.

Relationships.hierarchical: This rule is part of the 'Architectural compatibility & landscape screening' section.

logical_dependencies.description: The application of this rule is dependent on an external trigger (a requirement for a guard rail).

Qualifiers.scope: Provision of landscape screening for a construction or excavation site.
Qualifiers.applicability: All projects subject to Planning Department review.

Variables.name: is_screening_required
Variables.description: A boolean decision made by the Planning Dept. on whether screening is necessary.

Variables.name: screening_plan
Variables.description: The design, materials, and location of the landscape screening, if required.

Conditions.trigger: At the discretion of the 'Planning Dept.'
Conditions.ambiguous_language: The specific criteria used by the Planning Dept. to decide if screening is required are not defined.

Exceptions.description: No exceptions or alternatives are mentioned in the text.

Relationships.hierarchical: This rule is part of the 'Architectural compatibility & landscape screening' section.

logical_dependencies.description: The requirement for landscape screening is dependent on a discretionary decision by the Planning Dept.

Qualifiers.scope: Protection of trees from harm caused by excavation and related construction activities.

Variables.name: excavation_plan
Variables.description: The documented plan for excavation, which must account for tree root protection.

Variables.name: evidence_of_no_harm
Variables.description: Evidence provided by the owner to demonstrate that encroaching features or construction activities will not harm trees.
Variables.ambiguous_language: The required format, content, and standard of 'evidence' are not specified.

Variables.name: excavation_technique
Variables.description: The method used for excavation, which affects the area of disturbance (e.g., slope requirements).

Constants.name: Reference Manual
Constants.description: Must be consulted for other aspects of tree protection during construction.

Constants.name: Example Excavation Safety Slope
Constants.context: Provided as an example for some excavation techniques that may severely impact tree roots (Figure 38).

Conditions.logic: Excavation must be planned in a manner that does not harm tree roots.
Conditions.ambiguous_language: The definition of 'harm' is not provided in this text, likely defined in the 'Tree Technical Manual'.

Conditions.logic: Owner must provide evidence of no harm to trees PRIOR to issuance of a building permit.

Exceptions.description: The condition to provide 'evidence' implies that encroachment on a tree's root zone may be permissible if it can be proven to be non-harmful. This constitutes an implicit exception pathway.

Relationships.hierarchical: This rule is part of the 'Tree protection' section.

cross-references.description: This external manual must be consulted for further details on tree protection.

logical_dependencies.description: The issuance of a 'building permit' is dependent on the successful provision of 'evidence of no harm' to trees.
The 'excavation plan' is constrained by the location and extent of tree roots on both the subject and abutting properties.
